# Reference

# Utilities

import { utilityName } from './utilities'

# replace()

Replaces an item from an array.

  • Type: Array

Example:

import { replace } from './utilities'

let users = [
  {
    id: 1,
    name: 'John'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    name: 'Jane'
  }
]

user = replace(users, {
  id: 2,
  name: 'Joe'
})

console.log(user)

Returns

[
  {
    id: 1,
    name: 'John'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    name: 'Joe'
  }
]

# remove()

Remove an item from an array.

Example:

import { remove } from './utilities'

let users = [
  {
    id: 1,
    name: 'John'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    name: 'Jane'
  }
]

user = replace(users, {
  id: 2,
  name: 'Jane'
})

console.log(user)

Returns

[
  {
    id: 1,
    name: 'John'
  }
]

# hide()

{{ 'random text' | hide('text') }}

Returns:

'random'

# boolean()

# initials()

{{ 'Ilyas Deckers' | initials() }}

Returns:

'ID'

# truncate()

{{ 'Some long string, with random text' | truncate(15, '...') }}

Returns:

'Some long strin...'
